body_html:
Hi, I met the same problem as you.

I found that the error might be caused by the dataset downloading. After changing the line 37 WORK_DIRECTORY in tensorflow/tensorflow/models/image/mnist/convolutional.py to my own directory, everything worked fine when re-running the convolutional.py code.

I hope this will help you.
body_text:
Hi, I met the same problem as you.
I found that the error might be caused by the dataset downloading. After changing the line 37 WORK_DIRECTORY in tensorflow/tensorflow/models/image/mnist/convolutional.py to my own directory, everything worked fine when re-running the convolutional.py code.
I hope this will help you.
body:
Hi, I met the same problem as you. 

I found that the error might be caused by the dataset downloading. After changing the line 37 `WORK_DIRECTORY` in `tensorflow/tensorflow/models/image/mnist/convolutional.py` to my own directory, everything worked fine when re-running the `convolutional.py` code.

I hope this will help you.
